page.title: 05 Riccall Airfield Today
page.content: If you go there today, you can see all the broken lights at the side of the runway. You can still see the runway rings where aeroplanes were fastened. There are also bomb shelters. The airfield sheds are now used by farmers for storing fertilisers and machinery and-thanks to the darkness -to grow potatoes. There is a large air raid shelter under an artificial hill. The entrances are often flooded.Skipwith Common Nature Trail crosses runways 2 and 3 and the sites of wartime bomb stores. Most of the concrete has been removed from the large runway number 2. Some farmers have dug up cartridge cases. Bullets can be found with metal detectors. Aeroplane glass is occasionally found in ploughed fields by local children.
